explanation: help given, especially by the state or an organization, to people who need it, especially because they do not have enough money
sentence: Your taxes pay for welfare benefits such as unemployment and sickness pay.
sentence_gap: Your taxes pay for _______ benefits such as unemployment and sickness pay.

explanation: formal; the fact that you want and plan to do something
sentence: I spent half the morning on the phone, which wasn't really my intent.
sentence_gap: I spent half the morning on the phone, which wasn't really my ______.

explanation: the quality or state of being thick and sticky and not flowing easily
sentence: The viscosity of the fluid in the system can be modified.
sentence_gap: The _________ of the fluid in the system can be modified.

explanation: a place where water naturally flows out from the ground
sentence: Mount Sannine, which has a base of limestone, is the source of many mountain springs.
sentence_gap: Mount Sannine, which has a base of limestone, is the source of many mountain _______.

explanation: a small bird with pointed wings and a tail with two points that flies quickly and catches insects to eat as it flies
sentence: Certain of springtime, the swallows came!
sentence_gap: Certain of springtime, the ________ came!

explanation: to make a bad situation worse
sentence: Attempts to restrict parking in the city centre have further aggravated the problem of traffic congestion.
sentence_gap: Attempts to restrict parking in the city centre have further __________ the problem of traffic congestion.

explanation: a raised place in a church, with steps leading up to it, from which the priest or minister speaks to the people during a religious ceremony
sentence: The pulpit appears to be of Byzantine origin.
sentence_gap: The ______ appears to be of Byzantine origin.

explanation: the small solid pieces that sink to the bottom of some liquids, such as wine or coffee, that are not usually drunk
sentence: I wanted a last drink of coffee, but there were only dregs left.
sentence_gap: I wanted a last drink of coffee, but there were only _____ left.

explanation: very pale, in a way that looks unhealthy and not attractive
sentence: Next to his tanned face, hers seemed pallid and unhealthy.
sentence_gap: Next to his tanned face, hers seemed ______ and unhealthy.

explanation: formal; a particular way of walking; the particular way a horse walks or runs
sentence: I recognized his gait from a distance. The pony's gait slowed from a canter to a trot.
sentence_gap: I recognized his ____ from a distance. The pony's ____ slowed from a canter to a trot.

explanation: to make someone unhappy and angry
sentence: Years later, this unfairness still aggrieves him.
sentence_gap: Years later, this unfairness still _________ him.

explanation: hardly any; not very much and not as much as there should be
sentence: I paid scant attention to what she was saying.
sentence_gap: I paid _____ attention to what she was saying.

explanation: perfect happiness
sentence: Lying on a sunny beach is my idea of sheer bliss.
sentence_gap: Lying on a sunny beach is my idea of sheer _____.

explanation: a small insect that sucks the blood of animals
sentence: Several kinds of parasitic jungle ticks cause much annoyance to men and to beasts.
sentence_gap: Several kinds of parasitic jungle _____ cause much annoyance to men and to beasts.

explanation: formal; done before someone else can act, especially to prevent them doing what they had planned
sentence: The Treasury decided to raise interest rates as a pre-emptive measure against inflation.
sentence_gap: The Treasury decided to raise interest rates as a ___________ measure against inflation.

explanation: unfriendly and seeming to consider yourself better than other people
sentence: She has a rather haughty manner.
sentence_gap: She has a rather _______ manner.

explanation: an act of breaking a law, promise, agreement, or relationship
sentence: He was sued for breach of contract.
sentence_gap: He was sued for ______ of contract.

explanation: an area of water in a port that can be closed off and that is used for putting goods onto and taking them off ships or repairing ships
sentence: The ship sailed into the dock to be refitted.
sentence_gap: The ship sailed into the ____ to be refitted.

explanation: formal; to announce something publicly or officially, especially something positive
sentence: All the countries have proclaimed their loyalty to the alliance.
sentence_gap: All the countries have __________ their loyalty to the alliance.

explanation: formal; to make someone or something into a god; to consider someone or something to be so important that they are almost like a god
sentence: The Romans used to deify their emperors.
sentence_gap: The Romans used to _____ their emperors.

explanation: being saved from evil, especially according to the Christian religion
sentence: Others find in the gospel of redemption the true theodicy.
sentence_gap: Others find in the gospel of __________ the true theodicy.

explanation: a substance that is burnt to produce a sweet smell, especially as part of a religious ceremony
sentence: The commonest incense in ancient India was probably frankincense.
sentence_gap: The commonest _______ in ancient India was probably frank_______.

explanation: to be built or formed, or to happen, at an earlier date than something else in the past
sentence: These cave paintings predate any others which are known.
sentence_gap: These cave paintings _______ any others which are known.

explanation: formal; to describe or mark the edge of something
sentence: The main characters are clearly delineated in the first chapter. The boundary of the car park is delineated by a low brick wall.
sentence_gap: The main characters are clearly __________ in the first chapter. The boundary of the car park is __________ by a low brick wall.

explanation: formal; intended as punishment
sentence: There are calls for more punitive measures against people who drink and drive.
sentence_gap: There are calls for more ________ measures against people who drink and drive.

explanation: able to read and write; having knowledge of a particular subject, or a particular type of knowledge
sentence: The man was barely literate and took a long time to write his name.
sentence_gap: The man was barely ________ and took a long time to write his name.

explanation: (of a flag, sail, etc.) to become open from a rolled position, or to cause something to become open from a rolled position
sentence: The demonstrators unfurled a large banner.
sentence_gap: The demonstrators ________ a large banner.

explanation: to push or hit something forcefully and quickly, often with a thin or sharp object
sentence: The doctor jabbed the needle into the dog's leg.
sentence_gap: The doctor ______ the needle into the dog's leg.

explanation: old use; a bedroom
sentence: This film about Henry VIII is set, almost entirely, in the king's bedchamber.
sentence_gap: This film about Henry VIII is set, almost entirely, in the king's __________.

explanation: formal; to go up to or stop and speak to someone in a threatening way
sentence: I'm usually accosted by beggars and drunks as I walk to the station.
sentence_gap: I'm usually ________ by beggars and drunks as I walk to the station.

explanation: informal; an old man, especially one who is strange or humorous in some way
sentence: A couple of old codgers were sitting on the park bench, grumbling about the children.
sentence_gap: A couple of old _______ were sitting on the park bench, grumbling about the children.

explanation: continuing in a severe or extreme way
sentence: The sun was relentless.
sentence_gap: The sun was __________.

explanation: the part of you that judges how moral your own actions are and makes you feel guilty about bad things that you have done or things you feel responsible for
sentence: My conscience would really bother me if I wore a fur coat.
sentence_gap: My __________ would really bother me if I wore a fur coat.

explanation: a word that joins words, phrases or sentences, for example “and,” “but,” and “or”
sentence: When you write a series of nouns or adjectives, such as 'purple, green and blue', you use a conjunction before the last one, instead of a comma.
sentence_gap: When you write a series of nouns or adjectives, such as 'purple, green and blue', you use a ___________ before the last one, instead of a comma.

explanation: to supply or produce something positive such as a profit, an amount of food or information
sentence: The investigation yielded some unexpected results.
sentence_gap: The investigation _______ some unexpected results.

explanation: a feeling of happiness, usually because something good has happened to you, or something bad has happened to someone else
sentence: He rubbed his hands in glee as he thought of all the money he would make.
sentence_gap: He rubbed his hands in ____ as he thought of all the money he would make.

explanation: formal; to forcefully or angrily tell someone they should not have done a particular thing and criticize them for having done it
sentence: In newspaper articles she consistently upbraided those in authority who overstepped their limits.
sentence_gap: In newspaper articles she consistently _________ those in authority who overstepped their limits.

explanation: the time when you are not working or doing other duties
sentence: Most people only have a limited amount of leisure time.
sentence_gap: Most people only have a limited amount of _______ time.

explanation: to cut the wool off a sheep
sentence: It was time for the sheep to be shorn.
sentence_gap: It was time for the sheep to be _____.

explanation: to kill someone by covering their face so that they cannot breathe
sentence: He smothered the baby with a pillow.
sentence_gap: He _________ the baby with a pillow.

explanation: formal; the fact of something interesting or pleasant happening by chance
sentence: Meeting her like that, and there of all places, was true serendipity!
sentence_gap: Meeting her like that, and there of all places, was true ___________!

explanation: a situation or condition that is similar to what is wanted or expected, but is not exactly as hoped for
sentence: He was executed without even the semblance of a fair trial.
sentence_gap: He was executed without even the _________ of a fair trial.

explanation: the state of understanding and realizing something; the state of being awake, thinking, and knowing what is happening around you
sentence: There's a growing consciousness about environmental issues among young people. He lost consciousness for several minutes.
sentence_gap: There's a growing _____________ about environmental issues among young people. He lost _____________ for several minutes.

explanation: injury to someone caused by severe cold, usually to their toes, fingers, ears, or nose, that causes permanent loss of tissue
sentence: The climbers were all suffering from frostbite.
sentence_gap: The climbers were all suffering from _________.

explanation: formal; to limit someone's freedom of movement or activity
sentence: He felt himself trammeled by convention.
sentence_gap: He felt himself _________ by convention.

explanation: informal; a problem or difficulty, especially one that is small, hidden, or unexpected
sentence: There is just one small snag—where is the money coming from?
sentence_gap: There is just one small ____—where is the money coming from?

explanation: (of hair or fur) growing thickly
sentence: A lot of his face was hidden behind a bushy moustache.
sentence_gap: A lot of his face was hidden behind a _____ moustache.

explanation: a long period when there is little or no rain
sentence: The country's entire grain harvest has been hit by drought.
sentence_gap: The country's entire grain harvest has been hit by _______.

explanation: very bad or unpleasant; violent and shocking
sentence: Conditions in the prison were atrocious. She speaks French with an atrocious accent.
sentence_gap: Conditions in the prison were _________. She speaks French with an _________ accent.

explanation: refusing to smile or be pleasant to people, usually because you are angry about something
sentence: She brought along a couple of sulky kids who didn't say a word the whole time.
sentence_gap: She brought along a couple of _____ kids who didn't say a word the whole time.

explanation: a V-shaped cut in a hard surface
sentence: The stick has two notches, one at each end.
sentence_gap: The stick has two _______, one at each end.

explanation: formal; very near, next to, or touching
sentence: They work in adjacent buildings.
sentence_gap: They work in ________ buildings.

explanation: very ordinary, or having no interesting or exciting features or qualities
sentence: Their offices are in a nondescript building on the edge of town.
sentence_gap: Their offices are in a ___________ building on the edge of town.

explanation: (of a cat) to make a soft, low, continuous sound, or (of a machine) to make a similar sound
sentence: The cat purred as I stroked its fur.
sentence_gap: The cat ______ as I stroked its fur.

explanation: the bitter, yellow liquid produced by the liver that helps to digest fat
sentence: The critic's review of the play was just a paragraph of bile. Meat-eaters have to produce extensive bile acids in their intestines to properly digest the meat that they eat.
sentence_gap: The critic's review of the play was just a paragraph of ____. Meat-eaters have to produce extensive ____ acids in their intestines to properly digest the meat that they eat.

explanation: (the performance of) words that are believed to have a magical effect when spoken or sung
sentence: Around the fire, tribal elders chanted incantations.
sentence_gap: Around the fire, tribal elders chanted ____________.

explanation: an area of trees and bushes growing closely together
sentence: He spent the morning trying to work his way through a thicket of statistics.
sentence_gap: He spent the morning trying to work his way through a _______ of statistics.

explanation: not being careful or giving enough attention to people or things that are your responsibility
sentence: The judge said that the teacher had been negligent in allowing the children to swim in dangerous water.
sentence_gap: The judge said that the teacher had been _________ in allowing the children to swim in dangerous water.

explanation: not putting enough care, attention, or energy into something and so not doing it well enough
sentence: Discipline in the classroom is very slack. He's been very slack in his work lately.
sentence_gap: Discipline in the classroom is very _____. He's been very _____ in his work lately.

explanation: to deceive someone, usually by making that person do something that they did not intend to do
sentence: The girls were duped by drug smugglers into carrying heroin for them.
sentence_gap: The girls were _____ by drug smugglers into carrying heroin for them.

explanation: old-fashioned; someone with a large lump on their back, which makes them lean forward
sentence: Her appearance in The Hunchback of Notre Dame made her the first actress to earn ten million dollars for a movie role.
sentence_gap: Her appearance in The _________ of Notre Dame made her the first actress to earn ten million dollars for a movie role.

explanation: disapproving; without interest or color; dull and boring
sentence: She walked through the city centre with its drab, grey buildings and felt depressed.
sentence_gap: She walked through the city centre with its ____, grey buildings and felt depressed.

explanation: (especially of children) showing mental development or achievement much earlier than usual
sentence: A precocious child, she went to university at the age of 15.
sentence_gap: A __________ child, she went to university at the age of 15.

explanation: not moving or not able to move; not energetic or interesting
sentence: Vanessa lay inert on the sofa.
sentence_gap: Vanessa lay _____ on the sofa.

explanation: a grey, green, or yellow plant-like organism that grows on rocks, walls, and trees
sentence: The water moved silently over moss and lichen covered slabs of rocks, forming small pools in the low spots.
sentence_gap: The water moved silently over moss and ______ covered slabs of rocks, forming small pools in the low spots.

explanation: extremely angry
sentence: Dad will be livid when he finds out.
sentence_gap: Dad will be _____ when he finds out.

explanation: to smile widely
sentence: They grinned with delight when they heard our news.
sentence_gap: They _______ with delight when they heard our news.

explanation: to make a long, loud, deep sound
sentence: We could hear the lions roaring at the other end of the zoo.
sentence_gap: We could hear the lions _______ at the other end of the zoo.

explanation: used to describe a surface or color or paint that is not shiny
sentence: The paint is available in matte or gloss finish.
sentence_gap: The paint is available in _____ or gloss finish.

explanation: (of a word) to suggest a feeling, an idea, etc., as well as the main meaning
sentence: To me, chocolate connotes pleasure and indulgence.
sentence_gap: To me, chocolate ________ pleasure and indulgence.
